translated: a dreadlocked ascetic with matted hair,
both lived on the banks of the Ganges.
I lived on the upper bank,
and the brahmin lived on the lower bank.
he cursed me, ‘May your head split apart!’
If I had become angry then,
if I had not guarded my morality,
I would have made him like ashes.
The curse he then placed on me,
fell back on his own head,
and through my power he was freed.
I did not protect my life.
The seventh story, the story of Mātaṅga.
